website_summaries.verdict: A good deal for those looking for a pump that quickly fills their bicycle tire, but not a good fit for mountain bike tires or small tires like those on strollers or lawnmowers.
pros: Fast – gets bike tires from near-flat to 120 psi within 10-20 strokes
T-valve switch between Presta and Schrader valves is comparable to Topeak’s mechanism
Large, easy-to-see gauge is accurate at higher pressures
15-year warranty is backed up by fast response and replacement
cons: No cushioning at top and bottom of piston, so the pump slams into the ends of the chamber
The gauge is less accurate when filling lower-pressure tires
Plastic base flexes during use and seems flimsy
Trouble fitting the nozzle to small tires like strollers

customer_reviews.title: This pump worked well until it didn't. Havve written 2 emails with no response from company.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of use, the head would not stay attached to my presta style bike tire valves. After attaching to my tire, I would start pumping, and the the pump end would pop off the valve. I have emailed the company twice now, and have not received a response. I'm sure it just needs a new rubber washer/gasket to keep it attached to the valve or a new head assembly. Don't believe the 5 year warranty!!
customer_reviews.author: Bob F.

customer_reviews.title: Want to give five stars but...
customer_reviews.text: I'd really like to give this pump 5 Stars. It worked really well at first, but unfortunately it broke shortly after I had it. It seems that some piece on the inside of the presta side of the valve came out somehow. I contacted the company via their contact page with no response for a few days. Hoping they can make it right by replacing the missing piece and guiding Me Through Repair, refunding the money, or sending me a new pump.
customer_reviews.author: Dalan

customer_reviews.title: Unlock, attach and lock.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. As a first time pump user, it took me a few minutes to understand that you have first to leave arrow on the "unlocked" position, attach to bike and only then lock it. I could easily pump bikes tires.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of B & T

customer_reviews.title: Nice for schrader valves, not for presta.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pump for several bikes I own; some with schrader valves, some with presta valves. While it works great for schrader valves, it does not work as efficiently for presta valves. Locking the valve in place on a presta valve is a challenge; so is releasing it without losing lots of air in the process. Today I tried it again on one of my bikes with presta valves. Very frustrating process. I ended up having to use an older pump of a different brand. My final opinion; great for standard/schrader valves. If you are looking for a pump for presta valves, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: MickeyFanTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I've used my share of pumps over the years, both for bike tires and lots of sports balls. But this one--despite the stellar reviews--flat out didn't work. So my wife and father in law (he's an engineer) both tried it in all directions/configurations--repeatedly. Simply a lemon. We're returning it. Hope others have a better experience.
customer_reviews.author: S. Truman

customer_reviews.title: WARRANTIED!  They stood behind their pump!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easier to pump road-bike tires to ~105 PSI than many of my friends pumps - this is, perhaps, the most important thing for many users. Easy to use valve-lock mechanism that seems like it is built to last Easy to read Gauge (although I sometimes hold a single AAA-cell flashlight in my mouth to pump up the tires on dark 6:30 AM mornings). Feb 2019 - Pump gauge blew out 1 year + 1 week after I received it a year ago. Update a few days later, 08 FEB 2019 - The company warrantied the pump, and sent me a new one! Thank you, Vibrelli !
customer_reviews.author: Have Blue

customer_reviews.title: Air leaks from tube when lever is turned to center position to remove
customer_reviews.text: Either I got a bad pump, or there is a flaw in the design. When the switch is locked to pump, air flow is directed into the tube. Once fully pumped to the desired pressure, the switch must be returned to the center position to remove. At this point, air escapes from the tube, unless you pull the connector out as fast as you can to minimize pressure loss. There should be absolutely no air loss if the switch is in the center position. Air should move in one direction hopefully into the tube. None of the glue-less patches worked. Useless
customer_reviews.author: TimeTraveller

customer_reviews.title: Great pump. Period
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pump about 6 months ago and use it weekly. It is BY FAR the best quality, most efficient and easy to use pump I have owned in my 40 years of road cycling. New tires inflate in about 20 pumps - refills take 3 or 4 pumps and you're out the door. Any bad reviews citing the Presta/Schraeder thumb switch were written by folks that cannot follow simple directions. Quit wasting time reading reviews and BUY THIS PUMP. Its a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Pump
customer_reviews.text: *** NOT A PAID REVIEW *** Bottom Line: Excellent Bike Pump This is a review of the “Performance Bike Floor Pump”. I originally had a hand pump but it just wasn’t doing the job so I decided to give this a try. I have to say so far it’s been worth the investment. It’s very easy to use and gets the tire pressure up quickly. There are plenty of options out there but you won’t go wrong if you decide to give this one a try. Cons: - none so far Pros: - well made - easy to use
customer_reviews.author: jSanchez

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: This pump is very good at inflating the tires - even a car tire. But there are a couple of major issues at least with this particular pump. First it is inaccurate by 8 to 9 lbs. at least on one style of tire. On a presta valve on a carbon wheel I didn't dare go past about 80 lbs for concern about a blowout. The second issue was removing the head from the valve stem; it was very difficult on the presta valve. I'm going to return the pump.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shrout

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump because of the rave reviews on Amazon. Its inexpensive and OK, but I could not recommend it. The valve is a pain in the butt to operate and usually needs fiddling to get on and some luck to get off Prestas without loosing a bit of air. I use it for mountain bikes and the gauge isn't accurate at lower pressures. 30 psi indicated is like 32 or 34 actual. I have used it for a year, and it works just as OK-ly as the day i bought it so it is durable. I just don't like using it and have been shopping around for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: 2SlowJoe

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Used it a few times, does what pump does best. The head is pretty easy to use. Indeed the two types of heads are connected and when the valve is not in closed position air rushes out the other end. This is only when the valve is open, which is when you are putting the head on and taking it off. But here is a tip: put a finger over the other end.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Takes awhile to pump a tire
customer_reviews.text: I am comparing this bike floor pump to the one it is replacing (OVOS pump). Both pumps are similar in feature but the difference is the diameter of the tube. The Vibrelli pump has a considerable smaller diameter tube which means it takes longer to pump air into the tire compared to the OVOS. The OVOS pump would take about 8 pumps to get my tires to about 65psi, whereas the Vibrelli would take 16 pumps. I would return this pump and get another but they all look the same, small tube. I should have bought another Ovos pump even though it got 1 star from 1 person.
customer_reviews.author: CBerg

customer_reviews.title: Missing the Glueless Puncture Kit...otherwise a great product
customer_reviews.text: I like how it works well with both my presta road bike and shraeder beach cruiser. It feels well built and sturdy for the price. The display is easy to read as well. Overall a great product and would highly recommend it. However, mine was delivered without the promised Puncture kit which is pretty disappointing. It’s such a hassle going to the process of returning the product & reordering so I am hoping the seller will see this review and assist me with my issue. I will update the review once I get a response.
customer_reviews.author: Allein Marquez

customer_reviews.title: It may work better for a mountain bike tire but it's of no ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this item is so highly rated. Besides being cheap/flimsy and mostly plastic the pump itself is defective in its primary function. The gauge seems to be accurate in measuring PSI, however, upon unlocking off of a presta valve it releases 15-20 PSI, which means you would always have to over-inflate by that much to get the pressure you want. This of course is impossible with a high pressure road bike tire. It may work better for a mountain bike tire but it's of no use to those running high pressure. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: dave13748

customer_reviews.title: Solid pump with one design flaw
customer_reviews.text: After a few uses it appears solidly built and is relatively easy to use. HOWEVER there is one design flaw--when you put the lock lever back in neutral (to unlock the fitting from your valve stem), this opens the air path to whatever you were just inflating--meaning a bunch of air rushes out while you struggle to pull the fitting off the valve stem. So you're going to lose a few PSI from whatever you just inflated when you pull the pump fitting off. This is unavoidable.
customer_reviews.author: mittim13

customer_reviews.title: Possibly faulty, but doesn’t fit tire valve.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I have a Schrader valve on my bike tire and bought this because of the great reviews and comments on how easy this is to use. This bike pump has been infuriating. The Schrader side doesn’t “lock” into place. I have to continually hold it with one hand while pumping with the other. And, all of that work still doesn’t allow for the air to enter the tire. Upon closer examination, it doesn’t appear that the mechanisms fit on the Schrader valve at all. Get this if you want an arm workout but with zero results of your tire getting pumped. I’d return this product if I could, but I think I’ve had it too long.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Pump
customer_reviews.text: So far the pump has worked great. It's small in size, but seems to get the job done. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable option that works.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: It's okay BUT....
customer_reviews.text: I have a schwinn pump that's $15.  And the Schwinn 20 strokes filled up my airshot tank to 110PSI. It took 35 strokes with the vibrelli pump Not saying it's a bad pump at all but if a $15 pump can out-perform it I'm sorry it's just not worth it to me. The only reason I even got it is because I wanted a 160 PSI pump cause the schwinn will only go to 120 on the gauge but aside from that the Schwinn pump is way way better. Sorry Vibrelli I'll have to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Bratt

customer_reviews.title: Not the best performance for over 90 psi.
customer_reviews.text: My previous pump (specialized) years of service came to an end, so needed a new pump, but didn’t feel like going to the bike shop for it. So decided to get one on amazon filtering by reviews. This pump does not work with valve extensions. The grip of the tip just keeps loosing connection and getting expelled (like a rocket) by 90-95 psi, furthermore, takes forever to inflate a road bike tire (700x25). This pumps performed well on my kids bikes which tops 45psi. Thats why I’m keeping it, but need another more performance oriented for the TT and Road bike. Its an average pump obviously not oriented for road bike or TT bike users.
customer_reviews.author: Yabriel

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality pump at a good price, bought 2 so far
customer_reviews.text: These pumps are great. They area easy to use and seem sturdy. The price is nice too. I lent mine to a friend that was going on a road trip right before covid hit. She didn’t end up coming back when planned and ended up staying with family but the price was so good I just bought a second one and told her to keep my original which I had been using about 4 years and was still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Love It So Far
customer_reviews.text: Bike pumps are in short supply where I live. You can't get one at a sports outfitter due to covid. I had picked up the very last pump on the shelf, a foot pump, for $16. I used it three times before it was bent to hell. I got this yesterday and it's a WORLD of difference from a qualitative standpoint. Smooth action, easy to read and accurate gauge, it's lightweight and doesn't force you to overexert yourself to inflate a tire. Oh, and a five year warranty means you're covered for a while. Huge love for it right now. Super pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: nice pump, works with both types of valves so ...
customer_reviews.text: nice pump, works with both types of valves so I can use it with both my mountain and road bike. Ordered it at 10pm on a Wednesday and it arrived Friday afternoon, great service.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Personally would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the positive reviews, but sent it back almost right away. First thing is how small (short) it is. You really have to bend over to use the pump which is a bit of a issue with a bad back, also because it is so small, you are pumping a small volume of air each time. I did not find the attachment to the tire valve to be easy at all. It was quite difficult to get on and then hold it on while sealing with the lever. I have used a lot of pumps and have a hard time believing some of these reviews are legitimate after using this pump.
customer_reviews.author: flocrest

customer_reviews.title: Good bike pump for the money
customer_reviews.text: This pump has everything you want for a great price, my only reason for the 1 star deduction is that the valve is a bit hard to connect to the tires valve stem. It takes a bit of pressure to secure it on it, so if the tire is completely flat the tires valve stem tends to fall deeper in the wheel making it hard to get leverage to install the pumps valve on it. But not impossible.
customer_reviews.author: JMT

customer_reviews.title: It sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pump for over a year but I really hate it. I tried to get used to it but this pump is one thing that makes fixing a flat much more of a Royal pain. It is going in the trash. What is really bad is the double sided head. It has to get a really big bite to lock on and if it is not locked on just so then no air at all will get through when you try to pump with it. I bought a ten dollar pump at Walmart for airing up gas lines as a plumber and had no problems with it, but the head on this pump makes it worthless.
customer_reviews.author: charles h. jones

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on cheapo pumps, and buy this.
customer_reviews.text: We had bought super basic cheap pumps in the past just to save a few bucks. They were always so unstable, unwieldy, didn't lock smoothly allowing air to escape putting it on and off, and took way more effort to pump up a tire or ball. This, on the other hand, is solidly built, stable, and so easy and quick to use. What the heck were we wasting our time and money on before??? Wish we would have just spent the extra few $ in the first place to get this. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: For the love of books!!

customer_reviews.title: Plastic base
customer_reviews.text: I got this pump just a few days ago. I have my floor pump to my daughter's family. I used your pump once. Seems to be as advertised. One thing I have to complain about. The base is plastic! My pump i have away was solid aluminum and worth the extra money. I have a feeling I'll have to buy another pump due to fragile plastic base. Design one that stands time and punishment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pump, high quality
customer_reviews.text: Just bought myself a sweet brand new bike but it came with the tires partial deflated. I needed a bike pump that would also show me the PSI so I knew how much air to put in/take out. This thing came super fast and works just as advertised. It has two different sizes for the pump head, the standard bike size and the size you can hook a needle into. It pumped up my tires super quick and worked like a charm. I recommend this pump to anyone who is looking for a high quality pump.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Nice pump!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older floor pump that needed a presta adapter that just couldn't seem to fit correctly. It was almost impossible to get to the pressure I needed. What a difference this pump. I don't know if the older pump wasn't designed to get to the 80psi pressure I needed (even though its gauge goes over that), or it was the combo with the adapter but this pump worked effortlessly getting to 80psi. Just have to make sure you switch the valve selector at the end of the hose to Schrader or Presta---if it starts hissing you probably have it switched to the wrong valve type.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Although the price of this pump is quite reasonable, it doesn't perform as well as my previous pump, which I purchased at Walmart for about the same amount of money. It is difficult to secure the fitting onto the valve stems of my bicycle tires, and it takes a lot more effort to inject the proper amount of air into the tires. Therefore, I am somewhat disappointed with this pump.
customer_reviews.author: David Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't show PSI properly, and doesn't stay in the air cap by itself.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't show PSI properly or I would say at all, and doesn't stay in the air cap by itself. My friend had to tightly press it in the air cap of bike while I was pumping air. It pumps air well. But why it doesn't stay in the air cap by itself? I don't know why so many people left nice reviews. And because of trust to those I bought it. I am going to return it. And buy digital pump.
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: brilliant
customer_reviews.text: We have gone through quite a few pumps in our years and this is the most superior by far. For the same price you can buy a cheap pump from Walmart, but this is definitely the winner. It is surprisingly smooth, like, the action of the pump, ummm.... I'm trying to not make this awkward, but it is like churning the smoothest butter on the planet. It's like an honor to fill the kids' bicycle tires because this pump makes you feel like everything is going right in your life. The knob doesn't get in the way, it stays put on the tire nubbin, it just works great.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie and Chet

customer_reviews.title: Broke in about a week
customer_reviews.text: 1) one of the top reviews is absolutely right that this design is fundamentally flawed. you cannot remove the nozzle from the valve without losing significant air pressure in the process. 2) mine broke within a week. when you flip the lock on the pump a rod in the fitting is pushed into the the tire valve to open it, this rod fell out making the pump fitting absolutely worthless. this is a $30 product, that's crazy, DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sturgis

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pump and fantastic value.
customer_reviews.text: Tyre pressure can make quite a difference to rolling resistance. The data are not readily available and so I'm conducting tests. The Lezyne pumps have been the pump of choice for me, but their attitude towards customers was more than disappointing, and so decided to try something else. The pump does not have a release valve, and that raised the concern that the tyre was losing pressure on disengagement. I asked customer support, and their response was immediate, with good suggestions on how to make sure any pressure loss is minimal. Now it works well. This is a great pump and fantastic value.
customer_reviews.author: Usually Pleased

customer_reviews.title: Best home pump I have used
customer_reviews.text: I have only just received this, and have not used it on a Presta valve, only Schrader, but it works brilliantly for my needs. Tight seal, simple to use, beautiful super readable gauge, and powerful. Other pumps I have used feel more like a workout, this one inflates quickly and effortlessly. I can't speak to durability, but that looks good, too, based on other reviews. Wish I had bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: M. A Oberly

customer_reviews.title: Super bike tire pump
customer_reviews.text: We thought our flat bike tires were irreparable, but it turns out it was our faulty old bike pump which just wouldn't allow you to properly inflate the tires, no matter how hard you pumped. This Performance one pumped everything up just fine! It was like we got new bikes! However, you do need to remember which side you need, as there are two different attachments. On the other hand, if one doesn't fit, it's obviously the other.
customer_reviews.author: Clef Qian

customer_reviews.title: Presta-valve issues.
customer_reviews.text: Like many pumps, this one has an issue with releasing too much air upon disconnecting when using the Presta side. Shrader side seems fine which is nothing out-of-the-ordinary. Operating the locking mechanism is a bit tough for some reason. I prefer being able to do it with a single hand rather than having to use both. Gonna send this one back I'm afraid. Might be okay if you weren't planning on using Presta.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bicycle air pump
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Had it for a few weeks and not a single problem to report. The 2-way connector doesn't leak AT ALL. It creates a tight seal, and then when you take it off absolutely no air escapes. The large easy to read gauge appears to be accurate and precise. It's great, I'm really glad I ordered it. Now I'm spoiled with having perfect air pressure in my tires and will turn around 100 feet into a ride if one feels even a tiny bit low.
customer_reviews.author: C. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Best pump I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I've broke three pumps in three years, cracking the base somehow during light use. In such, I went looking for something with teeth, and am happy I found this product. The pumping action is nice and smooth (easily done with one hand). So easy in fact our 10 year old daughter had no issues. It easily connects to the tire and locks right on with the flip of a little switch. I'm actually planning on suggesting the local hardware store carry this product as a quality alternative to the two crappy pumps they sell.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S. Kolodziejczak

customer_reviews.title: Presta head attachment fails quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump a few months ago and have used it maybe 20 times for the 4 bikes in our household. Worked fine for about a month and then the presta head started popping off as soon as I start pumping. I'm running 35's tubeless and am only needing to get to 55psi but it pops off at about 15. Would not recommend this pump. Will be looking for a better one. For now, pumping is a two man operation, one to hold the presta head on and the other to pump.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike pump. It works well for my Specialized Ariel bike. I ride in NYC and it pumped my tires well to handle the potholes and uneven pavement. I like the pressure gauge especially. I like that it has three feet so it stands up by itself. I recall as a kid getting so frustrated every time the pump that is meant to be stood up to be used, could not stand up by itself. this is genius.
customer_reviews.author: GirlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great pump for my road bike tires. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great pump! Easy to connect to valve. Easy to pump up. I had been making do with a pump from another vendor that was always hit or miss re; getting a good connection to pump the air in. This pump connects right away. Now no hesitation to fill my tires to proper pressure before every ride on my road bike. Highly recommend. FYI, I also have the vibrelli mini pump and the vibrelli iPhone mount - both of those are also high quality products. And vibrelli customer service great!
customer_reviews.author: kettlemanTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Would not lock onto our stroller wheel!
customer_reviews.text: Received in seemingly good shape but the one we got seemed defective because it would not lock onto our BOB stroller at all! We tried both end points and it would never lock thus air would not go into the tire at all. Sadly we gave up and went to just buy a cheap pump at the store. I will try to get a refund and return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hubble Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Must have for bike owners
customer_reviews.text: I got a bike pump from walmart and thought it was okay till bike shop told me to get one with multiple tips and way to read tire pressure. I got this just because it seemed what I need for a good price. I liked it came with all tips and attachment and tire repair kit. The tire gauge has been so instrumental I can't believe I wasted money on cheap walmart one. Definitely a must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Tomasini

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, accurate gauge  at 40 lbs
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and aired up both bikes. They both take 40 lbs., so I don't know about the higher pressures. It worked well and did not let out much air when disconnecting the pump. That is one of the main reasons I got a pump with a gauge since you can loose air when disconnecting the pump and again when checking the pressure. I like the fact that it has a couple of clips to secure the hose when it is not in use. Overall, a nice purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste you time on cheaper, smaller pumps. Just get this and move on with your life lol
customer_reviews.text: This bike bump is a necessary routine when I go for a bike ride. It works with most bike tires if not all and is very easy to use. It sits up right in my shed and doesn't take up space. It's well worth the money if you ride alot and need to check your tire pressure before heading out. Don't waste your time on a smaller cheaper pump. Just get this and you'll never need to buy anything else
customer_reviews.author: James Griffith IV

customer_reviews.title: Pumped up car tire with it
customer_reviews.text: Used for my bikes and pumped up a few car tires without problem. Only thing is the accuracy of the gauge may be a couple or few psi's off what it actually is when I used an alternative measuring device. Other than that it seems great for the money. For those curious, it does take a good amount of effort to pump a car tire from 0 to 32psi. Less than 10 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Ni N

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this pump... this is my first full size presta style pump. I decided to get one of these since the handheld pump just wasnt doing it for me. What took me about 15 minutes each tire with the handheld only took me about 1 minute each tire with this pump. I didnt think it was this easy, but with 3 bikes with presta valves, I know I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Grade Ten

customer_reviews.title: Nice pump, connectors a bit tricky
customer_reviews.text: Great bicycle pump. Comes with adapters to fill sports balls or other inflatables. Connectors for shrader valves are a little finicky. Unclear how twisting ends on connections are intended to be used.
customer_reviews.author: diatonic

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump. They stand by their warranty
customer_reviews.text: This pump worked great right up to the 2yr marker. Then the gauge popped out and I reached out to the seller for warranty coverage. After a few days they sent a refund and I bought a new pump. The new pump seems to have a retrofit or new design that fixed the gauge problem from the old design.
customer_reviews.author: hecklers2002

customer_reviews.title: The Vibrelli’s clamp works like a comparitive dream
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing a Specialized floor pump mostly because the Specialized has a clamping mechanism that is near impossible to use without letting all the air out of your tire. The Vibrelli’s clamp works like a comparitive dream. It’s simple to operate, and actually works. No more “try 6 times to get the pump on and then let a big squirt of air out when you try to take the pump off” like the Specialized. I’m very very pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Schrader valve valve failed after 6 mo. and Presta valve failed after 18 mo.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for 18 months, and I'm guessing most reviewers wrote their positive reviews early on. The schrader valve valve on this pump stopped working after about 6 months, and now after 18 months the presta valve is gone. Buyers beware!
customer_reviews.author: Joshman

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: Well made pump, very nice gauge. After I have used this pump several times, I am not totally please with the way the pump valve snaps on to the tire valve. The locking lever is very difficult to maneuver. I sent a message via Vibrelli's web site but never got a response. Other than that it's a nice pump.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Henkelman

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed in 3.5 months
customer_reviews.text: I like this pump. It switches easily from normal to schrader valves, the gauge seems reasonably accurate, and the action is fine. I used it to pump up the tires on my RV. Yes, this is ridiculous, it took around 100 strokes per tire to go from 70 psi to 80 psi, which was a bit tiring. But it worked just fine, as the pump is good to well over 110 psi. A couple days later, I tried the pump and it no longer passes air at all. Something in there is blocked. Perhaps something overheated when I was pumping up the RV tires? In any case, it shouldn't fail after 400 cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Iain McClatchie

customer_reviews.title: Good power but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: [UPDATE]: Yeah, about it being flimsy? Totally wrong about that. I have used this pump at least 50 times since purchase. I no longer have concerns about durability. Excellent buy. [Original Review]: It pumps tires just fine, for the moment. My tires say to pump to 80 PSI and this has no problem going that high, and quickly. That said, the long pieces give the feel of being flimsy and are certainly not all metal. If you are going to routinely abuse your pump, this might not be the best.
customer_reviews.author: Haon the GreatTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pump several times and have never had any issues. I noted some people had issues with it damaging the valve core and I did the first time I used it. It bent the valve core slightly but not so much that it couldn't be used. I realized if you don't loosen the valve core all the way it works just fine and doesn't damage them.
customer_reviews.author: EricT

customer_reviews.title: It does the job just fine and is very versatile, but is more work than name-brand competitors' slightly more expensive pumps.
customer_reviews.text: Solid bike pump. One lesson learned from this purchase perhaps would have been to spend more money on a slightly nicer pump. A friend has a brand-name pump of this style (wide floor pedestal with gauge) and it pumps way more air per pump. The cylinder on this one -- hard to tell from the photos, I know -- is kind of puny compared to some nicer pumps. It does the job just fine and is very versatile, but is more work than name-brand competitors' slightly more expensive pumps.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer Pro

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pump: bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: Great pump! Versatile by servicing two valve types and stores easily - lost my first one in a move and immediately bought this one again. I’m not a fan of pumps you have to “screw” onto the presto valve before pumping. With this model the lever at the end of the hose securely locks it to the valve allowing for a super fast seal before pumping. Huge benefit for me since I frequently pump my tires immediately before my friends take off for the trails. Five stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Den D

customer_reviews.title: The pump has a got a great hiss but nothing else....because of user error.
customer_reviews.text: PART 1 This pump is crap. All it does is hiss and the pressure gauge moves a little but certainly not getting air in the tire. And YES, I am using the correct air outlet and shoving it as far down on the stem as it will go and locking it. Guess I am off to a local bike shop. PART 2. 2 hours later. User error. Its a great pump. YES, I WOULD BUY IT AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Best bike pump out there
customer_reviews.text: As much as I like supporting local businesses and bike shops, after comparing the features of this bike pump with others, the price differential was huge and this was by far the better value. The company shipped it quickly and packaged great, so when I got it, unpacked it and used it, I had no issues. The dual head feature for different valve stems was the key reason I bought this model, as I have different tubes/stems to deal with. Inflates quickly and solid construction. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: HDSportsPhotography

customer_reviews.title: Tire pressure gauge is very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The gauge on this is dangerously off. I filled my bike up to 60 psi when its rated for 65 and while I was packing my bag to go, the tire exploded with a loud bang. I figured it was a faulty tire and I didnt feel like replacing it, so I switched to my road bike. The tires for that say to fill to 90 psi and i only filled them to 75 to be cautious. A few minutes later i heard a hiss and the front tire had deflated.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I'm EXTREMELY please with Vibrelli's customer service. I received the pump, but when I would use it, the needle valve kept popping off of the pump at 60 lbs of pressure; even though it was in the locked position. I was only expecting a new valve, but they sent me a complete replacement. Sadly in the US, this kind of customer service is rapidly vanishing. I have a small business and treat my customers with the same respect; thus my success for the last 18 years. Thank you Vibrelli. You ROCK!
customer_reviews.author: Diane H Holycross

customer_reviews.title: So if you're eyes aren't great (like mine)
customer_reviews.text: Got it on sale for about $28. Wish I'd spent another $10 and gotten something that feels sturdier. Handle is plastic and you can really feel it bend when pumping. And the gauge lacks a marker to set to a particular inflation. So if you're eyes aren't great (like mine), you'll be stoping to check how much you've inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Trone-La

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in a very short time.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for the first few times I used it, but it has now stopped working completely. Got the tire filled using a neighbor's pump, so it was not the tube. Will be going to the bike shop to get another pump.
customer_reviews.author: DMK

customer_reviews.title: Good pump but tricky to use.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good floor pump. Easy to read gauge, stable base and pumps a good volume of air with each stroke. 5 year warranty is a big plus. I deleted two stars because to presta pump head is tricky to use. You have to yank it off instantly once you've released the locking lever to avoid losing air. Too bad, because otherwise it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: bike geezer gregg

customer_reviews.title: Good floor pump, for the persistent
customer_reviews.text: My second floor pump. The good is that it works and is good value. The bad is that it is definitely harder to attach the pump nozzle to a presta tube stem, based on my experience. However, if you can get used to this maneuver, it should work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kagan

customer_reviews.title: Nice pump for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the pump for about a month now. I like the ease of use, plus with my old pump I had to use a Presta adapter to use it with my road bike, and with this pump it comes with both the schrader and presta heads, making it a quick to go from one stem valve to the next. Definitely a good pump for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gene B

customer_reviews.title: Performs but a larger volume pump may perform better for the average male
customer_reviews.text: Came today. works will on Presta valve and traditional Schrader valve. I blew up a mountain bike tire and it took about 30 pumps of the handle to land at 40PSI. Performed well. I would like it to be taller with more air volume per pump (reason why not 5 stars). As a 200 lb strapping lad, I could handle a larger pump with less repetitions. If I used a foot pump, it wold have been 120 repetitions, so miles better than hopping your foot for 20 mins!
customer_reviews.author: David Reed

customer_reviews.title: Awkward valve for Presta, may not be best out there
customer_reviews.text: This bike pump started off ok but within a few months it stopped really connecting to Presta valves. Always a bit of a struggle with the two way lever. However, now once I fit it to a Presta on my bike it simply won’t put air in. I tried both tires, no luck whatsoever. Seems like something is wrong with the fitting that depresses the Presta pin to open the air channel into the tire. If I try pumping with that thing the air just gets stuck... doesn’t work for either tire.
customer_reviews.author: G M

customer_reviews.title: Great pump so far, glueless puncture kit included isn't even worth the effort to throw away
customer_reviews.text: The pump is great and I've not had a problem with it so far. I did get a chance to attempt to use the repair kit...it is utter trash. Throw it away immediately, it is utterly worthless and doesn't work at all. I did sand/roughen the tube. Cleaned it. Dried it. Put on the patches and inflated the tube. They blew off immidiately.
customer_reviews.author: Eff Of X

customer_reviews.title: Connector is a big problem depending what you are connecting it too.
customer_reviews.text: The problems listed in the reviews are representative of what I experienced. The tire stem connection head is too large and the clamp too stiff. This will not fit on the front tire stem of my motorcycles due to the size of this connector. Not enough space between the brake discs and rim. Once I got the connector attached to the rear tire, the connection was not secure and had to be reattached a couple times to get a good attachment. Compared to previous pumps, this took a lot more strokes to get the pressure in. I've returned the pump and would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Newton N Teichmann Jr

customer_reviews.title: The best pump bar none
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding bikes for 4 decades and in the course I have gone through countless pumps. I have been luke warm about most of them feeling like they just a utility tool. The Vitelli however is different. I want to go out and top off the air in our bikes even if they are full. The pump is superbly designed. Feels great. The valves fit perfectly. The pump motion is seamless. The large pressure dial is one of a kind. The craftsmanship is unique and the price very reasonable. This pump is a superb value. I bought a second one recently as a gift. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Oenophile

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: VERY happy with this purchase. Well-made and accurate on the gauge, even pumping was relatively easy up to 70 psi. Then it got tougher. I don't think I could get more than the required 80 psi into my tires but that could be a tire constraint, not the pump. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Card

customer_reviews.title: Great Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike pump at a great price. I’ve used it several times a week for nearly 3 years and it has worked perfectly. Then the screw/valve at the bottom became loose and it must’ve become misaligned, because it wouldn’t work properly. I contacted them and they sent me a brand new bike pump!
customer_reviews.author: Detailed

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I was only using a portable pump for my road bike for quite a while until I purchased this. GAME CHANGER!!! Super easy and LOVE the gauge on it so I can be more accurate with tires. Highly recommend! Haven't used the extra attachments, or adapters, but love that it is adjustable in case others need to borrow or use it as well!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Busbee

customer_reviews.title: Go slowly
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pump for cycling to top off my tires each day. Pump works well but not sure of it's accuracy, will have to check with an air gauge. My tires are 115-125psi and they were very hard before ever reaching 115psi. I will check with a gauge when I can pick one up , my feeling is the pump reads low so be cautious. The base is plastic and flexes a bit when using it, another caution to note.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid construction. Thick, hardened plastic body, stable base, large hand grip make for efficient and easy use. About four full pumps was all it took to inflate a tire from completely flat to full. Pressure gauge is also well constructed, accurate and large enough to easily read from a standing position. The pump is certainly too large to consider taking with you on a ride, but its ease of use makes it a perfect addition to your garage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: The pump is excellent. The lever to lock the valve is very ...
customer_reviews.text: The pump is excellent. The lever to lock the valve is very firm but the grip on it makes it easier to engage. The no air escape from the tire when disengaging (there is a little hiss but that is air escaping from the pump tubing). Side note: my first pump had an issue engaging and disengaging (lost a lot of air from the tire), I contacted Vibrelli and they immediately sent a new on for free without even asking for a return. I appreciate the good service and will stick with Vibrelli products. Much better than the flood of generic "fulfilled by amazon products" that swamp the Amazon searches nowadays (many with fake reviews).
customer_reviews.author: juice mcpatterson

customer_reviews.title: Works great on presto valve
customer_reviews.text: So at first I thought it was broken because the presto side wasn’t working correctly. Well it turns out I had a Dunlop adapter on my of my presto valves so I needed to take those off first and with presto you need to unscrew the top part slightly before putting the air pump on it. Works wonderfully and only takes 5-6 pumps to go from deflated to full.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, feels like quality. I purchased this so I could fill my wheelchair tires. I have no strength and was looking for something easy. I had to return an air compressor that didn't work for the same purpose and was very frustrated.. I thought this looked nice, was about the same price, hey why not. Wow, this works very nicely, smooth operation, fast fast fill, a gage right there that is super easy to read and quite accurate. This was a great purchase, I am glad I splurged on it.
customer_reviews.author: Yup

customer_reviews.title: Pump it up.  Waa ah waa ah waa wa waa
customer_reviews.text: I get to pumpin with this thing and dang if I don’t Get a riff playing in my head. Broke a nail engaging the valve lever (cause it’s a snapper) and in a fit of pique I palmed that valve and swung this pump round my head like David out to clobber Goliath and it didn’t even break. Gauge still accurate too, I calibrate it with the bulge popping out of the sidewall on my NIST certified check tire. It’s an accurate thing or at least close enough for me. Pump it up, it’s a pump, music extra.
customer_reviews.author: tacowhittler

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire Pump
customer_reviews.text: Got this tire pump two days ago. Seems to be of good quality. Used it today to inflate a new barrel tire and tube. It works just great easy to inflate to 30 psi. Did not wobble,gauge easy to read but it was a little difficult to lock on to value stem. Did not bleed off any air pressure when I removed. Planning to use a lot in future. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good but I wish I would have gotten something else.
customer_reviews.text: Nice plastic pump. I use it for a rode bike so I have the very thin valves. The tires require 110 psi and that is why I chose this pump. Problem is when I release the pump head from the valve stem, I lose about 30 psi bringing me down to about 80psi. Another issue I have found is when I attach the head to the valve, very often the two do not connect as designed and I cannot pump the tire.
customer_reviews.author: LBZ mom

customer_reviews.title: Frozen Rapid T-Value
customer_reviews.text: seems to have a problem with the rapid t-valve with switches quickly from presta to schrader. Send an email to vibrelli and now waiting for a repalcement. Follow-up! Its been 2 weeks and I have not received the replacement pump .Mike Collins, who is the Brand Manager, was suppose to have had his colleague Olivia arrange a replacement, but so far I haven't heard anything and it is 5-30-2017. Will redo review when new pump is received.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a bicycle pump expert or anything, but I've been using the same old Schwinn pump for years until it broke last week, and I got this after a quick search based on the reviews. I didn't think it could possibly be as good as the reviews said - a bicycle pump is just a bicycle pump - but either my Schwinn pump sucked, or this really is next-gen technology or something. It used to take me 20-30 reps to pump my tires after they'd been sitting a while (I used to get a real workout inflating my bike tires) but this pump does it in less than 10. Unbelievable. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Beam

customer_reviews.title: unable to connect filling valve to tire easily, constantly gives readings 100+ lbs and prevents ability ...
customer_reviews.text: unable to connect filling valve to tire easily, constantly gives readings 100+ lbs and prevents ability to fill the tires. Have to reconnect valve 3-4 times in order to release pump handle (pressure) to pump tire. Extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the same old pump for about ten years. When it finally became unreliable I decided to order this one based on the reviews here. It's as good as people say. Pumping my bike tires is effortless, and it's quite easy to attach the pump to my bike's presta valves. I'm over 50 and can clearly see the gauge which is nice compared to almost every other item I own. Worth the money. I hope it lasts, a long, long time.
customer_reviews.author: dogmother

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for nearly all of our bikes and balls.
customer_reviews.text: This item feels like a quality item compared to my schwinn pump. To switch from the normal valve to the other you just twist the closer. As long as the action of twisting the closer to the right or left never messes up the tire it will be a great purchase. I have used this on a road bike and a standard bike with training wheels. The gauge will just give you a general idea of the pressure on the road bikes as it seems to vary after each pump. For my use it was fine but if you need more exact measurements you may need to purchase something else..
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T. Wire

customer_reviews.title: Pumps OK but flawed
customer_reviews.text: It pumps tires just fine. The gauge is easy to read and seems accurate. It has one major flaw however. The stroke is too short. When you pull up on the handle you top out to quick. Makes for more smaller strokes. I have had a lot of pumps and this is the only one that this is an issue with. Should have been about 3 inches taller.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This bike pump comes with some metal and some plastic parts. It's not as sturdy as an all metal pump but, if all you do is air up a tire now and again, it's as much as anyone needs. I'm sure mine will last for many years. If you're a biking road warrior and want all the quality and precision of a pro, I still like the brand but would opt for a higher end version of the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Maria L

customer_reviews.title: Seems solid and well made
customer_reviews.text: Lots to like about this pump: a long hose (so no more awkward positions), solid and easy valve clamp (really - it just works and works well), a clear and easily read pressure guage (I have no way to test for accuracy, so... it looks good and I can read it!) Also important - it's stable, feels solid, and pushes a significant volume of air each cycle, so it doesn't take much time to reach pressure! So far, so great!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good for High Pressure and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: This pump is what I expected for the price. Most importantly, it does what I need it to do. I had no problem pumping up my road tire to 110 psi. It was easy to use the presta valve setting. Seems like this will be a suitable pump for tires that see occasional road and mountain biking.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hummer

customer_reviews.title: It just works and it's a great value
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but I think this pump is a great value. It is very easy to use the valve. Mine did not lose much air when I disconnect. It pumps a nice volume of air with each stroke. When I get to the desired pressure (105 psi on my road bike) I pump 1 additional time and then release the valve. I have used it on 2 presta bikes and 1 schrader (kids) bike. Even though the base is plastic, I think it will be durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to work
customer_reviews.text: after Watching 3 Youtube videos and item instructions book, I filled up 6 tires presta valves for my MTB and road tires. How do see the pressure pumped to tires? It stayed at 20 each time and tires were all HARD. This was main reason I got this item. If I can't read the true accurate pressure on tires each time with new pump, I may return it for full refund. I would rather NOT return. I want it to WORK gauge is accurately. Thanks -
customer_reviews.author: Damso

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and service
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good company and a very good quality product. It’s very sturdy and built well. I accidentally lost a screw to the top of the adapter and wrote them an email and they send one without charge. Thank you so much Olivia product manager.
customer_reviews.author: Jawaad Akbar

customer_reviews.title: The gauge is accurate!
customer_reviews.text: It pumps a smaller volume than some of my older pumps, but that let's you pump with less effort. To my pleasant surprise, the built in gauge is exactly accurate compared to my dial gauge, which was not true of my older bike pumps or compressors. It leaks very little air going on (especially if you put your finger over the other hole), and almost no air leak coming off. It seems sturdy and well built.
customer_reviews.author: M. Luce

customer_reviews.title: High quality good bike pump
customer_reviews.text: Do not be fooled by some of the other ones for only a few bucks cheaper. This thing came fast comes with everything you need for road bike and normal bike and attachments for everything else. Build quality is excellent! I am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: crmandy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bike pump
customer_reviews.text: I spent a long time reading through Amazon bike pump reviews and I'm pleased I selected this one. My husband has a Schraeder valve bike and I have Presta - we've used this pump on both bikes and switching between the nozzles is both easy and effective. I've wasted my time with cheaper portable pump options in the past and I'm glad that I've invested a little more in this reliable pump.
customer_reviews.author: Nina D

customer_reviews.title: Best Bike Pump
customer_reviews.text: I will probably be using this for decades to come. It is a great pump, very easy to use and read gauge. The only problem is getting a connection on bike valves, but those are always tricky because of how they are made. Buy it for life product here.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

product_meta.title: Vibrelli Bike Floor Pump with Gauge - High Pressure 160 PSI - Presta Valve Bike Pump Automatically Switches to Schrader - Bicycle Pump Comes with Glueless Puncture Kit
feature_bullets: LARGE ACCURATE GAUGE: Vibrelli’s bike pump with gauge is built and tested for high pressure precision. The bicycle pump pressure gauge is large, accurate, and easy to read.
RAPID T-VALVE: Presta valve bike pump also inflates Schrader valves, with a simple flick of a switch. The “Rapid T-Valve” on the bike tire pump seals strong with no annoying leaks
INFLATES TO 160 PSI: With a strong steel barrel and reinforced handle, Vibrelli’s bicycle tire pump is tested for accuracy to high pressure, it’s the perfect road bike pump

INCLUDES: Bike air pump comes with an Emergency Glueless Puncture Kit, don’t get caught out on the road or trail with a flat! Includes ball inflation needle and valve for inflatable devices, so you can use your bicycle pump for pool toys and sports balls
100% SATISFACTION : This Vibrelli Floor Pump is built to last, which is why it’s backed with a 5-Year Manufacturer’s

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
